Articles.Content: Never to Moho, the surface of Dres, or the moons of Jool. Eeloo was excluded as well.
I have been everywhere, some more than once

without cheats i've been only to duna, all kerbin moons and i did also a eve flyby

with cheats... ahem, i never visited: bop, pol, and ike.

I still need to do a Tylo mission. It shouldn't really be that hard with KSPI, right?

I also should try to move away from dropping puny landers over Eeloo and really try to settle down and build a proper permanent base there, but I haven't found the time.

I've never landed on Moho or everything past Dres.

My Eve lander in 0.23.5 tipped over.

The only body I have yet to go on is Eeloo. Just did a manned/return mission to Dres a couple days ago (Yey !).

I like planets with moons (and Jool was such awesomeness), too bad we can't have a Saturn, Uranus and Neptune variants. as well. I'd totally build a Base around Uranus (the most beautiful planet in the solar system IMHO).

I guess Eeloo is next until then tho =)

Eeloo, Bop, and Pol are the only bodies I have yet to explore in any form. However, as of writing this, there's probes/landers on route to all those bodies.

Manned, I have yet to sent anything to the Jool system or to Eeloo, and while I have orbited Eve, I have yet to send a manned lander to the surface. I've also have never sent a manned ship to get up close and personal to Kerbol.

Unmanned, I have yet to go to Eeloo, Bop or Pol in any form, and I have sent probes to orbit to all other bodies except Tylo and Vall (only flybys). While I have landed on the surface of Gilly manned (both with and without the aid of a ship ), I have yet to land on its surface unmanned, it just seemed unnecessary, although contracts may change that in the future. And in addition to Gilly and the ones I haven't been to at all, I've yet to land unmanned on Tylo and Vall as well.
I once made Kerbin orbit extremely closely to the Sun. (Hyperedit)

Not all have been manned missions but I have been everywhere but Moho. Don't know why I am never been bothered to send anything there. And I haven't sent anything to Eve since the .21 days.

Generally play around the Duna, Jool and Kerbin systems. And Eeloo and Dres have been visited only onced I think in 0.22 or 0.21, both were successful apollo type missions...

I play sandbox only though.

Minmus is my current maximum distance from Kerbin.

I never really found a reason to go further then that.

I still have a lot of eastereggs to go to on Kerbin! I will get around to landing at specific coods when I advance in career mode, currently I can go anywhere but with mild precision.

Moho and Eeloo remain untouched as does the Joolian system but I currently have a ship heading that way with multiple landers etc, probably going to do all but Laythe and send a seperate mission there with a spaceplane.

Okay here goes. I have never been to:

Kerbol

Moho

Eve

Kerbin (not all of it anyway)

Duna

Dres

Jool

Eeloo

Gilly

Ike

Laythe

Vall

Tylo

Bop, or...

Pol

Because I suck at making ships
Pretty much everywhere! Bad computer, bad travel.

Pretty much everywhere! Bad computer, bad travel.

Pentium G2358, Ã‚Â£45 motherboard, use rest of parts from current desktop - Ã‚Â£95 play ksp like a boss.

Pentium G2358

Such a ridiculously good value for single-thread performance. I'm getting close to pulling the trigger on a new build around one.

Such a ridiculously good value for single-thread performance. I'm getting close to pulling the trigger on a new build around one.

And it's got two cores, so when physics is multithreaded you wont be left behind too much - it's also the same socket as great i5's so there's a great upgrade path too.

Edit: And the fact on a Ã‚Â£45 mobo with a bios flash you can hit 4.7ghz on air.
Never been on Tylo and bop
I'm really just now starting. I just launched my first Duna ship.
In all my 1000+ (stopped using the steam version after about 900) hours in KSP, I've never actually landed on Eeloo...

In the current version of KSP. I haven't gone anywhere beyond Kerbin. In past versions of KSP I have landed Probes on the Mun and Minmus. I have taken crews to the Mun and back, And have taken a few crews to the Mun who either died on the mun, or got suck in Orbit between Kerbin and the Mun. (RIP Crew of Orion III *Taps begins Playing*)

Currently, I want to go to the Mun and back. But I still have the level of a novice and use MacJeb (Deal with it trolls!) and all the Tutorials are either really outdated or there are none at all. (If someone could update the info on the KSP Wiki on the article "How to land on the Mun using MacJeb" that would be great)

I have never sent a craft beyond Kerbin or the Mun or Minmus, I really want to go to Laythe and possibly even Eve or Duna, and even Eeloo (even if its just Probes, I want to touch the Solar System!)

(PS. If anyone has some handy directions on how to get to the Mun or Minmus in the current version of KSP, please send me an inbox. The Polar Bear Astronauts really want some Mun Rocks )
With a new, 100% stock .24 career mode, I've landed on everything possible.

Updated list!

in my actual carrer (not old carrer or sandbox or hyperedit)

manned:

kerbin

mun

minmus

duna

ike

gilly

dres

probe:

eve

laythe

vall

bop

pol

next target:

manned to the outter jool system

my old wish:

walking on dres *done*

the hardest one was gilly... Orbiting and descending with 20m/s... Zzzzzzzz... And try not to flip the craft while exiting and entering it...
I've yet to land on Tylo. And to leave Laythe. And to check the easter eggs except for the second KSC (well, and the island to the west). And the moholes.

Considering my sig, I should probably mention Pol.

Never been to Pol. Every single time I try to go Pol, something always goes wrong. Be it the Jool aerocapture fail, be it an accidental power-outage (caught between Jool and Kerbol with an Ion engine and small batteries) leaving me unable to burn and thus causing me to crash into Tylo...

Krak, even the time I decided to go to Bop and then maaaybe Pol, NOPE. Don't even get to the Jool system - I stage twice by mistake and end up with only Ions firing before the transfer window was even ready.

Pol is cursed. The game says Bop is home to the Kraken, well Pol is home to bad luck in everything you do.

Edited September 11, 2014 by MisterDoubleSevens
Pol = Cursed

I have not sent any vehicle beyond Duna, but this will soon change.

Since I posted this Sept 2nd, I have orbited every planet and moon except Eeloo in an attempt to unlock the tech tree in science mode with only space walks and crew reports from space (no landings, no science equipment),

During this time I have finally become good at interplanetary travel. The biggest things I learned was that I can use Kerbal Alarm Clock to set up transfer windows and "focus" on a planet to set up my arrival.

I also learned that I can fly to the Mun and back without batteries, Duna and Eve without solar panels. It was a lot of fun.
